title: Add Gallery pictures section to the site

requirements.text: Add a new “Gallery” section to the single-page site that displays the user-uploaded images in a responsive grid, including a section heading and short descriptive text in English.
acceptanceCriteria: A new section exists with id="gallery" and is rendered in the main page flow.
The section displays the available gallery images in a responsive grid (e.g., 1 column on mobile, 2+ columns on larger screens).
All user-facing text in the section is in English.

requirements.text: Add the uploaded image (image-1.jpg) as a static frontend asset and render it in the Gallery section with an English alt attribute.
acceptanceCriteria: The file image-1.jpg is included as a static asset under frontend/public/assets (or a subfolder) and loads successfully in production.
The Gallery section renders image-1.jpg and the has a descriptive English alt attribute.

requirements.text: Implement an image preview interaction in the Gallery section so that clicking a thumbnail opens a larger preview (modal/lightbox) with the image and accessible controls to close.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking a gallery thumbnail opens a modal/lightbox with a larger version of the same image.
The modal can be closed via an explicit close control and via Escape key.
Focus management and aria attributes are present/appropriate per the UI component used (e.g., shadcn Dialog).

requirements.text: Add “Gallery” to the site navigation so users can smoothly scroll to the Gallery section from both desktop and mobile menus.
acceptanceCriteria: The header navigation includes a “Gallery” link pointing to #gallery.
Clicking “Gallery” smoothly scrolls to the Gallery section on both desktop and mobile navigation.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing UI components instead).
Do not edit frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, or frontend/src/main.tsx.
nonGoals: No backend/canister changes or persistence for gallery images (static assets only).
No user-upload flow for adding/removing images via the UI.
